title: Splitgate: Arena Reloaded Will Relaunch The Halo-Meets-Portal Shooter After A Rough Year
description: After some very public missteps and an unprecedented return to beta, Splitgate is hoping to make a comeback under a new name. At the PC Games Show, 1047 Games announced that Splitgate 2 will return as Splitgate: Arena Reloaded on December 17, with massive gameplay and progression changes that aim to bring the shooter closer to its roots. According to 1047 Games design director Josh Watson, the studio has been rebuilding the game "from the ground up," incorporating and refining the best elements from both Splitgate games while "removing what didn't work." In a video announcement, Watson specifically cited Unreal Tournament, Quake, and Halo as the main inspirations for Splitgate. To that end, the rebooted Splitgate will lack the Factions and Abilities introduced in Splitgate 2 for a more "classic arena combat" experience. Arena Reloaded also contains retooled progression and ranked systems, along with reduced in-game store prices; Splitgate 2's microtransactions were a major pain point with players when the game first launched. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: The Hobbit Trilogy 4K Blu-Ray Discounted To Only $34 At Amazon
description: The Hobbit Trilogy: Theatrical & Extended Editions (4K Blu-ray) $34 (was $90) See at Amazon The Hobbit Trilogy's 4K Blu-ray edition was noticeably absent in Amazon's Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales. If you were hoping to score a great deal on Peter Jackson's prequel series adaptation, you're in luck: Amazon is now offering a limited-time discount on The Hobbit Trilogy: Theatrical & Extended Editions. Fans can snag the 4K Blu-ray edition for only $34. It's unclear when this deal ends, but Amazon's store page notes it is "selling fast." Amazon also has new limited-time deals on standard Blu-ray editions of The Lord of the Rings and The Hobbit. These deals weren't available during the Cyber Monday sale either. The Lord of the Rings Trilogy Remastered Theatrical Edition is up for grabs for only $10 (was $25), and the Middle-earth 6-Film Theatrical Collection on Blu-ray is only $24.49 (was $63). Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Metroid Prime 4 Has Optional Music Locked Behind $30 Paywall
description: Metroid Prime 4: Beyond is out this week, ending an 18-year hiatus between this game and the release of Metroid Prime 3: Corruption in 2007. Samus Aran picks up a few new tricks in this sequel, including her new bike, the Vi-O-La. But if you want to hear some optional ambient music while Samus cruises the deserts of planet Viewros, it's going to cost you $30 or the price of a Samus Aran Amiibo. Players have discovered that plugging in the Samus Amiibo enables Vi-O-La Radio, which enables players to choose the music that accompanies Samus's extended journey across the Sol Valley desert on the Vi-O-La. There is already some ambient music and noise to go with those scenes, this just allows players to choose music tracks from other areas to listen to. Finishing the game will also unlock two additional tracks for Vi-O-La Radio. The regular ambient music of Sol Valley doesn't make it a bad experience, and it seems to be evoking something thematically about the planet's history. The music may not be necessary, but some fans may resent having to pay for an option that could have just as easily been included in the base game. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Five Nights at Freddy's 2 review: a messy movie, lost in FNAF lore

title: Hello Sunshine Is A Survival Game With A Literally Massive Twist
description: You'd be forgiven for losing track of how many survival games have come out in the last decade or so, and though I personally enjoy many of them myself, it's exciting to see a new one come along and dramatically overhaul what a survival game looks like, mechanically speaking. In a crowded genre, Hello Sunshine stands out. Yes, it's a survival game with many of the mechanics you'd expect, but it doesn't look quite like any others, thanks to its one (literally) huge twist. That twist is the gigantic robot companion you have by your side. The building-sized automaton walks almost ceaselessly toward a destination, and it's your mission to use its shadow to stay safe from the scorching sun, while strategically dashing into landmarks to quickly loot supplies, all while you dodge other, smaller bots along the way. Hello Sunshine is set in a post-apocalyptic world full of antagonistic robots, and if you're to survive, you'll need to scavenge food, water, and materials to build tools and weapons--all while avoiding the unforgiving rays of the sun. But rather than settle down and build a base for yourself and your robo-pal, you're almost always on the move. It's a much more nomadic experience than, say, Valheim or Minecraft. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Just Cause Creator Revs Up With New Action Game Samson
description: In 2020, Just Cause creator and Avalanche Studios founder Christofer Sundberg started a new company, Liquid Swords, alongside other industry veterans. Now, the team at Liquid Swords has shared the first trailer for its debut action title, Samson: A Tyndalston Story. It may remind some fans of Grand Theft Auto, but there are differences that make it a lot harder to earn money in this game. Tyndalston is the name of the city, and players will step into the role of Samson McCray, an aging criminal who is facing a crushing debt. Players can steal the money they need, but this isn't like other open-world crime games where you can keep going non-stop. Samson has physical limits as to what he can pull off in a day, which are measured by action points. Use too many on a single job and you won't be able to do much else. As time passes in this world, your debt increases. For every crime you commit, the city remembers and your reputation grows. According to Liquid Swords, "There are no do-overs. You move forward because standing still makes everything worse." This is a story about debt, consequences, and survival. Samson will have to deal with all three on a daily basis. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Best Warzone And BO7 Perks For Season 1
description: Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 has integrated with Warzone for Season 1, adding the full BO7 weapon pool, attachments, and other gear into battle royale. The big update also overhauls Warzone's perk system, so here we'll highlight all the perks in the game and include some recommended picks for your next match of battle royale. Season 1 removes the Wildcard perks from Black Ops 6, and instead, you'll have Overkill by default. This means you can equip a second primary weapon without the need to select any specific perks to your loadouts. The update also changes how some of the perks work in Warzone. Popular choices from last year may not be as beneficial this year, while other perks are buffed to be much more viable for Black Ops 7's integration. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Criterion Collection 50% Off Movie Deals Restocked At Amazon - Sale Ends December 7
description: The Criterion Collection Holiday Sale Save 50% on Blu-rays through December 7 at Amazon. See at Amazon Amazon's Black Friday and Cyber Monday sales have ended, but physical media enthusiasts still have a few more days to save 50% on movies and box sets in The Criterion Collection. The semiannual promotion at Amazon and Barnes & Noble runs through December 7. Amazon has restocked a bunch of notable 4K and 1080p Blu-rays that sold out over the past few weeks, including 4K Blu-ray editions of Stanley Kubrick's Eyes Wide Shut, Kurosawa's Seven Samurai, No Country for Old Men, The Breakfast Club, The Princess Bride, WALL-E, Flow, Uncut Gems, and Punch-Drunk Love. The Breakfast Club and Eyes Wide Shut are two of the newest Criterion releases featured in the sale. Other notable recent additions to Criterion's 4K Blu-ray catalog that are in stock as of December 4 include Twin Peaks: Fire Walk with Me, The Wes Anderson Archive, Isle of Dogs, The French Dispatch, and Academy Award-winning animated movie Flow--and this one actually comes with multiple movies. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Microsoft Flight Simulator 2024's New Crossover Is One You'll Never Expect
description: Microsoft has announced the next crossover collaboration for Microsoft Flight Simulator 24, and it's none other than Netflix's hugely popular Stranger Things. "Turn the skies upside down," Microsoft said in its announcement for a collaboration set to come to the game on December 9. The teaser video doesn't give much away, but one possibility is that the upcoming crossover will allow people to fly through Hawkins, the setting of Stranger Things. If you look closely, you can see the aircraft in question in the video is a UH-1H Huey helicopter with the "Hawkins Heli-Tours" logo emblazoned on it. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Save $50 On The PS5 Fortnite Bundle Through December 24
description: PS5 Fortnite Flowering Chaos Console Bundle $450 (was $500) See at Amazon See at PS Direct See at Walmart See at Target See at Best Buy PS5 Digital Edition Fortnite Flowering Chaos Console Bundle $400 (was $500) See at Amazon See at PS Direct See at Walmart See at Target See at Best Buy With the holiday season fast approaching, now is a great time to pick up a new console for the young gamer in your life. If you're looking for a deal, Sony recently discounted its Fortnite PS5 bundles by $50 for a limited time. There are two options available, including a Fortnite-themed PS5 console bundled with limited-edition Fortnite DLC for $450 (was $500), and a similar package that includes the PS5 Digital Edition and Fortnite DLC for $400 (was $450). These bundle deals are part of Sony's official Black Friday PlayStation deals, and will be available until December 24. PS5 Fortnite Flowering Chaos Console Bundle $450 (was $500) This PS5 bundle includes a 1TB version of the console with a disc drive, allowing you to both install games from a disc and watch Blu-rays--both 4K UHD and standard--on the machine. The bundled Fortnite DLC includes the following cosmetics and finishers: Florin outfit (Lego style included) Blossom Backpack Back Bling Floral Finisher pickaxe Blue Blossom's Wrap Petal's Edge Guitar Blue Bloom Mic Petal Steppers Kicks 1,000 V-Bucks (in-game currency) Additionally, the PS5 console comes with a DualSense controller. This is more advanced than your typical controller, as it features nuanced haptic feedback, Adaptive Triggers, a speaker, and a built-in microphone. See at Amazon See at PS Direct See at Walmart PS5 Digital Edition Fortnite Flowering Chaos Console Bundle $400 (was $500) The PS5 Digital Edition console doesn't come with a disc drive, but the PS5 Disc Drive is sold as an optional accessory for this console model and the PS5 Pro. This version of the console also has a smaller SSD--825GB compared to the 1TB in the version above--but that still provides more than enough space to install Fortnite and several other games on it. You'll get the same Fortnite DLC with this console bundle and a single DualSense controller. See at Amazon See at PS Direct See at Walmart Other PS5 consoles are also on sale in PlayStation's Black Friday event, including the limited-edition Ghost of Yotei PS5 Slim bundle. It includes the PS5 Slim console with unique faceplates featuring artwork based on the game, a matching DualSense controller, and a digital copy of Ghost of Tsushima, all for $500 (was $600). PlayStation's 2025 Holiday Sale also includes deals on DualSense Wireless Controllers, the PlayStation Portal Remote Player, Pulse Explore Earbuds and the Pulse Elite Headset, and a bunch of first-party games. The PS5 console deals run through December 24, but the other hardware deals end December 18. Check out all the PlayStation Black Friday deals below. Black Friday PlayStation Hardware Deals PlayStation 5 Console Deals PS5 Pro 2TB -- $659 ($750) Ghost of Yotei PS5 Slim Bundle (Black) -- $500 ($600) Ghost of Yotei PS5 Slim Bundle (Gold) -- $499 ($600) Fortnite PS5 Slim 1TB Bundle -- $450 Fortnite PS5 Slim Digital 825GB Bundle -- $400 NBA 2K26 PS5 Slim 1TB Bundle -- $450 PS5 Slim 1TB -- $449 ($550) PS5 Slim Digital 1TB -- $399 ($500) PS5 Add-on Hardware Deals PlayStation Portal Remote Player -- $179 ($200) PSVR 2 Horizon Call of the Mountain Bundle -- $299 ($400) PlayStation Controller Deals DualSense Edge Controller -- $169 ($200) DualSense Controller -- $55-$65 ($75-$85) PlayStation Access Controller -- $70 ($90) PlayStation Audio Deals Pulse Explore Earbuds -- $169 ($200) Pulse Elite Headset -- $169 ($200) See all PlayStation hardware deals Limited Edition DualSense Controllers If you're picking up extra controllers, it's worth noting PlayStation's Limited Edition DualSense Controllers are included in the holiday promotion, but they are starting to sell out. Continue Reading at GameSpot

title: Even Football Is Now An Xbox, As Xbox Is Sponsoring A College Football Bowl Game This Year
description: Microsoft is sponsoring a college football bowl game, with the first-ever "Xbox Bowl" taking place on Thursday, December 18 with Missouri State taking on Arkansas State. The Xbox Bowl is the replacement for the Bahamas Bowl, which will not happen this year. In a press statement, broadcaster ESPN--which is carrying the event--said there will be "fun, Xbox-themed moments and in-venue activations designed specifically for the bow." The event is taking place in Frisco, Texas at the Ford Center. In recent times, Microsoft rolled out a new "This Is An Xbox" marketing campaign, so now even football is an Xbox, in some manner at least. Continue Reading at GameSpot
